page.title: 10TOURISM, MUTHILL AREA.
page.content: Muthill is an outstanding Conservation Area ( classified as such in 1975 by Historic Buildings Council for Scotland).It has many old houses built in the 18th century.There is a ruined church with ancient churchyard kept up by the Dept. of the Environment, an attractive playpark, village green, bowling and golf clubs. Near to the village is Drummond Castle (gardens open to the public) and Strathallan airfield with its collection of old planes including a Comet, Shackleton, Lancaster and other planes of interest to enthusiasts. In Crieff (3 miles) are three small factories and a distillery with guided tours.Muthill has many attractive walks and is also a good centre for touring. Fishing is available on the River Earn not far away.The village Museum is worth a visit.
